meanings.definition: One who practices or prepares for a performance.
meanings.sent1: The rehearser diligently practiced their lines for the play.
meanings.sent2: The talented rehearser always arrived early to practice with the cast.
meanings.sent3: The rehearser accidentally bumped into the stage curtain during practice.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication as a rehearser shone brightly on the stage.
meanings.sent5: The young rehearser's passion for acting was evident in every rehearsal.

meanings.definition: To practice or prepare for a performance.
meanings.sent1: She would rehearse her dance routine every day after school.
meanings.sent2: The band members rehearse together to perfect their music.
meanings.sent3: He decided to rehearse his speech in front of the mirror for fun.
meanings.sent4: The athletes rehearse their moves like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The students rehearse their lines with enthusiasm for the school play.
